author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1705775897}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965820698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1642358613}
review: This is the niche indie art house film of computer games. It's low budget, creative, weird, self-aware, awkward, heartfelt and if you've ever gone out of your way to find and support games (and developers) for no other reason than to thumb your nose at the AAA publishing houses and reward people who just want to build their own bizarre passion projects then add this one to the list, especially if it's on sale. If it was a film, it would only get screened at a couple of really small independent cinemas that only those in the know are even aware of because the Normals won't get it. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198042620952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1382, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1636580360}
review:
[h1] Genre [/h1] Ein Kurzes FMV Adventure

[h1] Story [/h1] Wir spielen einen Mann namens "Steve", der anscheinend Angst Zustände hat. Wir spielen 2 verschiedene Geschichten bzw. Situation aus dem Alltag, die er überwinden muss

[h1] Gameplay [/h1] Wir schauen uns die Geschichte bzw. die Videos an und treffen dann immer eine Entscheidung. Es gibt meist 3 Entscheidungs Möglichkeiten von denen wir natürlich eine Auswählen müssen. Falls eine Entscheidung mal zu einem Ende führt, kann man direkt vor der Wahl wieder anfangen. Ich weiß das es um ein ernstes Thema geht, ich habe selber schon mit Leuten zu tun gehabt die unter Angstzuständen leiden und das ist echt belastend für einen Solchen Menschen. Teilweise verstehe was das Spiel bzw. der Entwickler damit aussagen möchte aber der Humor der hier gezeigt wird, ist für mich persönlich überhaupt nichts, ich fand nichts davon Lustig. Es ist halt ein ganz spezieller Humor, den man mögen muss aber ich finde es nimmt dem Thema an sich die Ernsthaftigkeit

[h1] Achievements [/h1] Es gibt insgesamt 3 Erfolge. Hierfür muss man Beide Geschichten durchspielen und "Steve" an bestimmten Stellen sterben lassen

[h1] Pro/Contra [/h1]
+ Kurz
+ Achievements
+ Sammelkarten

- Der Humor war absolut nicht meins (muss man mögen)

[h1] Fazit [/h1] Ich kann das Spiel nur Achievement Hunter Empfehlen die ein schnelles 100% Spiel wollen. Der Humor war absolut nicht meins und ich fand es nahm das Thema die Ernsthaftigkeit. Soll es nun ein Comedy Spiel sein oder doch eher ein ernsthaftes Spiel, ich bin mir da nicht wirklich sicher. Es hat mir einfach nicht gefallen

author: {'steamid': '76561198015483969', 'num_games_owned': 5460, 'num_reviews': 426, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1635592567}
review: Лютый андеграунд про умственно отсталого больного дауна бомжеватого вида, пытающегося открыть дверь, в двух действиях. Это не игра, это писец. Во-первых она полностью состоит из видео, сюжет, постановка, режиссура -  достойны наград независимых фестивалей. а происходящее на экране это вынос мозга и полное его отсутствие. Главный действующий и единственный персонаж страдающий от дебилизма занимается откровенной хернёй и "самовыпиливается" от повседневных действий. Слишком много времени отведено лицезрению на героя, где он ничего не делает: сидит, смотрит, стоит, "тупит" - треть времени наверное уходит на просмотр "этого". А сама история это вершина "наваленной кучи", такой бред из ничего создан, му-а, смаковать надо ценителям особенного искусства.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137763058', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1632665964}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969880352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1592924198}
review:
While I appreciate what the creator is trying to do here, it's not my cup of tea. There's not a lot of nuance or depth. It just drives the point home with the force of a semi truck.

And for something so short, the way to succeed can still be confusing. I never really connected to the protagonist though, so when I failed it felt like it didn't matter.

There are a couple legitimately funny moments, but I don't think it's worth going through everything else just to experience them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078528248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1647038741}
review:
This game changed my life

Before i played this game, my erectile disfunction was destrpying my marriage... my wife would cheet on me woth many men and woman every night just to satisifie her urges...... After playing this game, i saw life in a new light, god not only came into my life, but he also came into me...

some people wonder how to fix world hunger, other worry about peace, while me? i simply play The Awkward Steve Duology, this is my religion, i shall worship him for many many years to come.

IT IS A GENUIE CRIME, THAT THIS GAME COSTS A MEARLY £2.79!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! i would pay 20 times that ammount in order to expereicne a life changing event such as this. i dont care if this may ruin the terms of service, BUT I NEED TO SEE ADAM!!! I can only ship Adam and Steve, as they are perfect for each other... After seeing this game... i keep seeing those two in my dreams... I used to be a simple farmers boy, but now, i am an extravegant buisness owner who owns a small company by the name of Macdonaold, however, i cutrently live in japan, where i reside in a small village. More specifically: My house is in the northeast section of Morioh, where all the villas are, and I am not married. I work as an employee for the Kame Yu department stores, and I get home every day by 8 PM at the latest. I don't smoke, but I occasionally drink. I'm in bed by 11 PM, and make sure I get eight hours of sleep, no matter what. After having a glass of warm milk and doing about twenty minutes of stretches before going to bed, I usually have no problems sleeping until morning. Just like a baby, I wake up without any fatigue or stress in the morning. I was told there were no issues at my last check-up. I'm trying to explain that I'm a person who wishes to live a very quiet life. I take care not to trouble myself with any enemies, like winning and losing, that would cause me to lose sleep at night. That is how I deal with society, and I know that is what brings me happiness. Although, if I were to fight I wouldn't lose to anyone.

In the end, i belive that everyone should expereince this game at least once- this is where boys become men, and girls become boys.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055524546', 'num_games_owned': 1715, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1574927027}

author: {'steamid': '76561198128385623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1580872199}
review: This was an interesting concept - it's like an interactive silent film. I don't think I'd quite call this a game, so if that's what you're looking for you might want to look somewhere else. With that out of the way, however, I found it had memorable moments and made me laugh out loud at least once, so that's pretty good. I definitely found the commentary on anxiety relatable and would recommend this game to anyone looking for that kind of subject matter.

review: Странная игра, мне история понравилась. Наверное было настроение такое, что хотелось сыграть во что-то "странное".

author: {'steamid': '76561197999747491', 'num_games_owned': 1568, 'num_reviews': 449, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1526165319}
review:
Nicht wirklich ein Spiel, mehr ein interaktives Erlebnis. Das Ganze ist aufgeteilt in 2 separate "Stories", die völlig unabhängig voneinander laufen (abgesehen von der Hauptfigur). Man merkt, dass es eine totale Low-Budget-Produktion ist und obwohl man nach gut einer Stunde so ziemlich alles gesehen hat, hat es so gewisse Längen. Zudem trifft man hier einens ehr, sehr eigenwilligen Stil und Humor an, der sicher nicht jedemanns Geschmack ist und der auch sehr gewöhnungsbedürftig ist (leeres, übertriebenes Lippenbewegen als Simulation für Sprechen? Come on, wirklich?!?).
Letztlich ist es ein typischer Vertreter der Sorte "Spiel", für die man nicht mit vollem herzen den Daumen hoch geben kann. Aber ich persönlich kann eben auch keinen Daumen runtergeben, denn obwohl es in jeder Hinsicht sehr speziell ist (Machart, Stories, Qualität), ist es eben auch nicht völliger Schrott. Im Gegenteil, da ich durchaus absurden Humor lustig finde, hatte ich einige sehr unterhaltsame Momente und ich bereue es nicht, dieses Spiel ausprobiert zu haben. Deshalb war es trotz allem gute Unterhaltung. Nichts, was man ständig spielen kann, aber doch etwas, dass ich mit Abstrichen weiterempfehlen kann.

Fazit: Definitiv kein Spiel für jedemann. Wer Gameplay sucht, sollte dieses Spiel ignorieren. Aber wer auf absurden Humor steht und/oder auch mit einem sehr eigenwilligen und teilweise etwas abstrusen Erlebnis etwas anfangen kann, der bekommt hier einen kurzen, durchaus gelungenen Einblick in das Erleben eines Intorvertierten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009833080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1524778317}
review:
Two fairly short but nevertheless very charming episodes, 
and it's tricky to write a review without giving away any spoilers.
Could relate to the anxiety a bit too well, found the solutions to work with /or around it very appealing.
The bathroom-date is something very cute and sensitive and left enough room for wild assumptions.
I liked the actor and his approaches to find a niché in this fast paced world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203279901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1627345137}
review:
Bought game on sale on a splurge. Played game. Never related so much to a game as much as game. Enjoyed game.

In all seriousness though, The Awkward Steve Duology gives a comical, yet simplistic, realistic, dumbed down version of what anxiety feels like to people who literally cannot comprehend what the heck it's like to live with anxiety every day in a short span of time. I have anxiety and this FMV object d'art gave me good laughs.

If you're just planning on playing the two "games" within this d'art, it'll take you like 15-30 minutes at max each. If, for some reason, you're looking to get acheivements like me, it'll take you a lot less than the time I have logged in if you just power through all the options.

10/10 across all boards. I demand more games from Oh, a Rock! Studios right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026240050', 'num_games_owned': 1255, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1594198782}
review:
I'm so glad I stumbled across this game. It's simple and short, but genuinely entertaining. The Awkward Steve Duology is actually two short games, where you play as Steve, who suffers from Social Anxiety.

The games are FMV games, that is Full Motion Video, or to put it more plainly, actual real life video clips. You're given options like OPEN THE DOOR or HIDE UNDER THE TABLE and then you pick one and a short video plays. So, pretty basic. I think what makes this game stand out is the quality of the writing. It's funny, and also relatable. The first adventure is about a stranger knocking on your door, and trying to reduce your anxiety enough to actually answer it. The second is about your housemate hosting a party and being too nervous to leave the bathroom.



So, would I recommend? Yes. I don't think you even necessarily have to be into weird little indie games to give this one a shot. But it'd help. In any case, I give this 3.5/5 stars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166778330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1524618796}
review: Did not know what to expect with this game but was pleasantly surprised. The game was short but highly entertaining and both episodes provided different but enjoyable experiences. Definitely a great game to stream. Overall, highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198418549470', 'num_games_owned': 1157, 'num_reviews': 654, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1614548048}
review: On the fence about giving recommendation here. Be aware that the games are short. Shhhoooort! I was seeing repeated video after only a handful of minutes. Maybe, as long as you go into this looking for a feel-good experience, perhaps to explore your own feelings of social anxiety, then I would recommend getting this game. If you are instead looking for an excellent, modern FMV, then check out Press X Not to Die here on steam. Also one technical snafu, TASD must be played in windowed mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972319820', 'num_games_owned': 753, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1559528013}
review:
The first part was goofy and fun, while also touching on the issue of severe anxiety, but portrayed in a that ca make you laugh.
The second part was goofy and fun, while also sucker punching you in the face and making you cry.
It definitely isn't a game for everyone, but if you like nonsensical humor and/or having your emotions do a 180, this game might be for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087834803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1514820026}

author: {'steamid': '76561198082287142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1645461583}
review:
One of the best impulse buys in a while.

The concept of The Awkward Steve Duology is so ridiculously simple, I was actually shocked by how little there is to it. This two-part FMV adventure game is an absurd little look in the life of someone who seems cripplingly awkward. The player follows the titular Awkward Steve as he is thrust into two anxiety-triggering situations: answering the door and being stuck in a bathroom during a party. 

The first segment is pretty hilarious, and trust me, I wanted to get in the damn box ([b]spoilers[/b]). The second one continues the humour and general oddness, but with a far more satisfying story. If you don't feel something by the end of it, you're a heartless bastard. 

Just kidding.

But no, seriously. This is great. I loved this way more than I should have. I related to it all too well, and I can't relate to anything. I applaud thee, Paul Franzen. 

[i]clap clap clap[/i]

review: I enjoyed this little one man project, a lovable main character who strangely enough I connected with.  Not to mention I laughed out loud at many points during the short journey the game took me on.  Not often a game can do that to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982572424', 'num_games_owned': 1385, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1501194904}
review:
The Awkward Steve Duology is a series about introversion taken to its logical extreme. It's often really funny, though a lot of it also hits pretty close to home (at least for me). I mean, who [i]hasn't[/i] locked themselves in their room and pretended not to be there while your roomate throws a party? Right? ...right?? T_T

If you like weird, funny FMV choose-your-own-adventure games, or if you're an introvert, you'll probably enjoy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277424153', 'num_games_owned': 798, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1500449000}
review: I ship Adam and Steve.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052575335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1501109024}
review:
It isn’t easy to explain “THE AWKWARD STEVE DUOLOGY”.  But I will bravely state that it manages to pull off a deceptively-unique experience that shines a spotlight on the thought-process of an awkward person with anxiety.

This game captures the humor and turmoil of a seemingly mundane task as an anxious person might see it.

The humorous distractions peppered throughout the experience mirrors the real-world mental exercises overthinkers go through to avoid that which brings them fear, no matter how ridiculous. It blurs the lines between creativity, humor, and fear, which is something every awkward person can relate to.

The artistic license used in “Steve’s” interactions with everyday items helps to reinforce how silly the overarching fear may actually be. At the end of the day, I don’t believe this truth is lost on Steve.

The final product is an experience that may hit too close to home for some. 

10 out of 10 “hand” soaps

author: {'steamid': '76561197971140266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1500693238}
review: Incredible touches of humanity, humor, and even some wicked good camera angles.  It hits close to home in a delightfully surrealistic, yet still incredibly genuine, way.  We are all Steve.
